user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_CountSemGive_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_CountSemGive_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_count_sem_table, *token);

    if (sem_post(&impl->id) < 0)
    {
        return OS_SEM_FAILURE;
    }

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_CountSemGive_Impl:
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t OS_impl_count_sem_table[OS_MAX_COUNT_SEMAPHORES]
...
typedef struct
{
    sem_t id;
} OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
...
#define OS_SEM_FAILURE (-6)
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No unreachable code was identified in the provided function or the related definitions. Reasoning:
- Control flow: sem_post(&impl->id) can return either a negative value (leading to the return OS_SEM_FAILURE;) or a non-negative value (execution falls through to return OS_SUCCESS;). Both return sites are reachable based on the runtime result of sem_post.
- There are no statements after an unconditional return, no infinite loops, no conditional blocks that can never be true/false by construction, and no switch/case constructs with unreferenced cases in the shown code.
- The OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET macro usage (OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_count_sem_table, *token)) expands to take the address of the dereferenced token (&(*token)), which is equivalent to the original token pointer and does not produce dead code.
- The related definitions (array of records, struct with sem_t, OS_ObjectIndexFromToken inline) do not introduce unreachable code in this context.
Given the shown code and related symbols, there are no fragments that appear to be unreachable and thus none require investigation for MISRA C:2023 Rule 2.1.
